page.title: 06HOLY TRINITY CH. BURRINGTON
page.content: The church was built{1150-1550}by the Abbot of Tavistock, and was cared for by these Benedictine monks until the Dissolution of the Monasteries by Henry V111.It was heavily restored by Architect Haywood in 1869.At present it is held in plurality with High Bickington and Atherington, in the Deanery of Chulmleigh in the Diocese of Exeter.The Vicar is the Rev.Vincent Gillett, M.Sc., F.Coll.P. INTERESTING FEATURES: The{PORCH}is 16th.century, but the door arch much older.The{DOOR}is of very heavy mediaeval oak with Tudor decoration.Tradition says Cromwell's musket shot marked the door. The{PILLARS} are of Dartmoor granite. The{SCREEN}is one of the finest in England, one of the last before the Reformation.Each of the nine ribs and eight arches is slightly different.
